LanguageData.Celsius_MountainTemperatureMode_Vanilla_: Mountains provide a constant underground temperature (similar to vanilla behaviour).
LanguageData.Celsius_MountainTemperatureMode_AnnualAv: Mountains provide a stable temperature throughout the year, which is defined by the map's climate.
LanguageData.Celsius_MountainTemperatureMode_SeasonAv: Mountains provide a temperature that gradually changes with season.
LanguageData.Celsius_MountainTemperatureMode_AmbientA: Mountains have no special thermal effect, their temperature is the same as outdoor temperature.
LanguageData.Celsius_MountainTemperatureMode_Manual_t: Set mountain temperature to your wishes.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_Vanilla_tooltip: Use vanilla color scheme for heat overlay instead of Celsius'.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_ShowTempTooltip_tooltip: When heat overlay is on, show a tooltip next to the cursor with the cell's exact temperature.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_FreezingAndMelting_tool: Water can freeze, and ice can melt into water.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_AdvAutoignition_tooltip: Flammable things can spontaneously catch fire when they get too hot. Replaces vanilla autoignition.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_PawnWeatherEffects_tool: Wind chill and wetness affect comfortable temperatures.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_TempDisplayDigits_toolt: How many digits to print after point for temperatures. Default value: {0}
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_TakeOwnRisk: Change the values below at your own risk.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_ConvectionConductivityE: How much air convection increases air conductivity. Recommended value: {0}.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_EnvironmentDiffusion_to: How strongly environment (e.g. outdoor) temperature affects cell temperatures. Recommended value: {0}.
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_HeatPush_tooltip: Effect of things that produce or reduce heat (e.g. fires, heaters and coolers).
LanguageData.Celsius_Settings_DebugMode_tooltip: Verbose logging of Celsius' work. Necessary for bug reports.
